intro: Alniaria chengii, commonly known as the Cheng's alder, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Betulaceae family, which includes birches and alders. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in catkins, typically in early spring. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
